The provided Node.js code is a module export that defines a set of linting rules and their configurations for ESLint, a popular JavaScript linting tool. The script uses CommonJS module syntax to export an object containing rules and configurations. It imports necessary configurations and rules from other modules located in the same directory, using a custom `__importDefault` utility to ensure compatibility with CommonJS and ES module imports. This exported object is typically consumed by ESLint to enforce coding standards and practices defined within the extracted configurations.

Here's the rewritten code:

```javascript
"use strict";

const rules = require("./rules").default;
const allConfig = require("./configs/all").default;
const baseConfig = require("./configs/base").default;
const recommendedConfig = require("./configs/recommended").default;
const recommendedTypeCheckingConfig = require("./configs/recommended-requiring-type-checking").default;
const eslintRecommendedConfig = require("./configs/eslint-recommended").default;

module.exports = {
    rules: rules,
    configs: {
        all: allConfig,
        base: baseConfig,
        recommended: recommendedConfig,
        'eslint-recommended': eslintRecommendedConfig,
        'recommended-requiring-type-checking': recommendedTypeCheckingConfig,
    },
};
```
